Nuno not interested in league table after Forest move within six points of top
arts.sum: Goals from Morgan Gibbs-White, Chris Wood and Taiwo Awoniyi earned a sixth successive Premier League win.

arts.ttl: Wolves 'tried everything' against Nottingham Forest - Pereira
arts.sum: VÃ­tor Pereira says he is "proud" of his Wolves side because they "tried everything" against Nottingham Forest in their 3-0 home defeat at Molineux.

arts.ttl: Premier League release statement on why VAR decided not to award Nottingham Forest a penalty vs Wolves
Nottingham Forest extend winning run as Gibbs-White returns to haunt Wolves
arts.sum: Just as Wolves had started to dream of a brighter future under VÃ­tor Pereira, it was the ghosts of the past that haunted Molineux as their former head coach Nuno EspÃ­rito Santo and academy product Morgan Gibbs-White snatched the points to send Nottingham Forest level with second-placed Arsenal. Wolves were unbeaten under Pereira and the superior side for much of the match but as they saw chances come and go, while portraying Gibbs-White as a pantomime villain, it seemed inevitable what the outcome would be. Nuno took Wolves into Europe and is plotting the same trick with Forest after a sixth victory in a row, sealed by goals from Gibbs-White, Chris Wood and Taiwo Awoniyi. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Wolverhampton Wanderers 0-3 Nottingham Forest: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Nuno Espirito Santo defeats former team
arts.sum: Nottingham Forest extend Premier League winning run with 3-0 victory over wasteful Wolverhampton Wanderers, marking their first six successive top-flight wins since 1979.

arts.ttl: Nottingham Forest move within six points of leaders Liverpool with win at Wolves
arts.sum: A brilliant season under Nuno Espirito Santo continued at Molineux thanks to goals from Morgan Gibbs-White, Chris Wood and Taiwo Awoniyi.

Wolves v Nottingham Forest: Premier League â€“ live
arts.sum: Minute-by-minute coverage of the 8pm UK time kick-off Any comments? You can send Michael an email If Forest keep this form up, itâ€™s not inconceivable that Hudson-Odoi could add to his three England caps. That left wing spot is definitely up for grabs. Anthony Gordon probably is the pick at the moment on form, with Phil Foden, Jadon Sancho, Jamie Gittens, Eberechi Eze, Jack Grealish also in the reckoning. Am I forgetting anyone? I guess Bukayo Saka or Jarrod Bowen could play there, but not their natural position. England manager Thomas Tuchel is also in the house. The only English footballers in either line up are Tommy Doyle (Wolves), Elliot Anderson, Callum Hudson-Odoi and Morgan Gibbs-White (Forest). Continue reading...
